channel.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
channel.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

image.title: Al Jazeera – Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera
image.description: Breaking News, World News and Video from Al Jazeera

item.title: Myanmar regime condemns Malaysia call for ASEAN to work with NUG
item.description: Military-appointed foreign minister says Malaysia's proposal is 'irresponsible and reckless'.

item.title: Solomon Islands says it will restrict Chinese police
item.description: Solomon Islands envoy to Australia says Chinese police stationed there will be under local command.

item.title: Hong Kong to open beaches, extend nightlife as COVID curbs ease
item.description: Financial hub's coronavirus restrictions have battered business and prompted tens of thousands of residents to leave.

item.title: US Supreme Court set to overturn landmark abortion ruling: Report
item.description: Draft opinion obtained by Politico suggests justices could overturn 1973 Roe v Wade, which allowed abortion nationwide.

item.title: South Korea’s consumer prices rise at fastest pace since 2008
item.description: Asia’s fourth-largest economy saw its consumer price index rise 4.8 percent last month from a year earlier.

item.title: Hong Kong’s ex-cop leader-to-be faces doubts on economic chops
item.description: John Lee to take over business hub as economy languishes after two years of political crackdowns and pandemic controls.

item.title: Hundreds flee homes in US southwest as massive wildfire advances
item.description: Calf Canyon Wildfire east of Santa Fe, New Mexico, scorches swath of land, threatens mountain communities.

item.title: British Virgin Islands protesters condemn UK direct rule plan
item.description: Report commissioned by Queen's representative had called for Caribbean territory to be effectively governed by London.

item.title: In Photos: Gazans Celebrate Eid al-Fitr in Comfort
item.description: Tensions and the exchange of rocket fire between Gaza and Israel during Ramadan raised fears of a new attack on Gaza.

item.title: Estimated 3,000 people flee armed clashes in northern Iraq
item.description: Clashes first erupted on Sunday when the Iraqi military launched an operation to clear the area of YBS forces.

item.title: Egyptian researcher’s death requires ‘thorough’ probe, US says
item.description: Egyptian authorities say economic researcher Ayman Hadhoud died in a state mental health facility in early March.

item.title: Spirit Airlines prefers takeover bid from Frontier over JetBlue
item.description: The development was a reversal from last month, when Spirit was said to have favoured JetBlue's offer.

item.title: Wage gap costs some Asian women $3,000 a year: Report
item.description: An Asian American, Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander woman stands to lose $120,000 over 40 years, the report warned.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine live news: US says Putin to annex Luhansk, Donetsk
item.description: US ambassador to OSCE says credible intelligence suggests Moscow will attempt to annex occupied Luhansk and Donetsk.

item.title: Why has Chad delayed a national peace dialogue?
item.description: Scheduled talks between the military government, opposition and rebels are postponed for a second time.

item.title: UEFA bans Russia from more European competitions
item.description: Russia banned from taking part in Women's Euro 2022 and club sides banned from next season's Champions League.

item.title: Amazon defeats drive to unionize second New York facility
item.description: Amazon workers at a facility in Staten Island voted not to join an upstart union.

item.title: Burkina Faso investigates mine flood as rescue efforts continue
item.description: Prime Minister Albert Ouedraogo says the managers of the Canada-based mining company have been banned from travelling.

item.title: Germany says could drop opposition to Russian oil ban
item.description: Two ministers say Berlin ready to back EU ban on Russian oil imports and warn of potential economic costs.

item.title: US factory activity grows at slowest pace in nearly two years
item.description: Manufacturers have become more anxious about supply in the coming months due to new COVID-19 lockdowns in China.

item.title: Around 600 Palestinians held by Israel without charge, group says
item.description: So-called administrative detainees are held based on 'secret evidence', and are held for renewable six-month periods.

item.title: US: Ex-police officer charged with murder in boy’s shooting
item.description: Prosecutors say Thomas 'TJ' Siderio, 12, was unarmed and on ground when former Philadelphia officer fired fatal shot.

item.title: US Capitol riot: Jury convicts NYPD veteran of assaulting officer
item.description: Verdict comes as House panel investigating January 6, 2021 riot requests cooperation of three Republican legislators.

item.title: US midterms 2022 : What to watch in Ohio, Indiana primaries
item.description: Will candidates backed by former President Donald Trump win against other Republicans?

item.title: US Supreme Court backs Christian group in Boston flag case
item.description: Boston said raising flag of Christian group could violate the First Amendment that bars state endorsement of a religion.
